column4: hey, what should i do, if I update my ubuntu 8.04 I always get his:   the following packages have been kept back: firefox firefox-3.0 firefox-3.0-gnome-support
What command are you using to upgrade?
sudo apt-get update , and then sudo apt-get upgrade
You probably need to use apt-get dist-upgrade
doesn't sudo apt-get dist-upgrade upgrades ubuntu to higher version?
No. See the message from ubottu above.
I assure you dist-upgrade will not upgrade your Ubuntu to the next release.
where can i look for the !upgrade command, or should i ask where do i look for what specific command stands for?
man update or something like that?
Its a command for ubottu, our channel bot  /msg ubottu upgrade
thanks, look like dist-upgrade solved this
i used this dist-upgrade, and now it deleted firefox
Can you pastebin exactly what it did?
sory, i thought that command "firefox-3.6" would launch firefox in terminal, , but the command "firefox" is correct
Okay, good to hear things are working :)
gimp 2.8 doesn't even exist.
yes, sorry but i still cannot install gimp 2.7 under ubuntu 8.04 :'(
zenmap is one of them.
What is 'Numark Total Control'? A windows app?
http://www.numark.com/omnicontrol
You may want to ask in #ubuntustudio or #opensourcemusicians
